vision.notes: Deep-sea fish, so vision is likely important for detecting bioluminescence and movement in low-light conditions.

photoreception.notes: Some species possess photophores, suggesting the capability to detect light emitted by other organisms (bioluminescence). The arrangement varies, with some having them along the tongue and ventral surface.

mechanoreception.notes: Likely possess a lateral line system for detecting vibrations and pressure changes in the water, common in fish.

chemoreception.notes: Presumed to have olfactory capabilities for detecting chemical cues in the deep sea environment, aiding in prey detection and navigation.
